meanings.definition: The uppermost sail on a mast of a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The topsails caught the wind and propelled the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to hoist the topsails to increase speed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the topsails, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the topsails glowed like golden wings against the darkening sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind filling the topsails was like nature's own song.

meanings.definition: The sails above the lowermost sails on a mast of a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The topsails fluttered gracefully in the breeze, guiding the ship's course.
meanings.sent2: Sailors quickly adjusted the topsails to catch the changing wind direction.
meanings.sent3: A curious dolphin leaped over the topsails, surprising the crew.
meanings.sent4: The topsails danced in the sky, painting a picture of freedom and adventure.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the topsails against the blue sky was a symbol of maritime beauty.
